column5: We are planning a trip to a boat-in camp on the woman river early September. Since we cannot go back to town I would want to get my tackle right. Our main focus is walleye. What kind of bait and tackle do I need to start preparing for the trip?Thanks
Have some heavier jigs and weights along as you may have to fish some deeper water.

I have done some guiding forcanada north lodge.have seen there outpost cabin.very nice.further you go up river you will get into some real deep water.the fishing is very good on that system.jigging will work fine and depending on wind 1/8 -3/8 oz jigs will do.i prefer to use lindy rigs at that time of the year.there will still be fish in the river sections between the lakes and are much easier to catch.
